name: Michaela Pilters
background: Michaela Pilters serves as Commissioning Editor, Culture and Society at Deutsche Welle (DW). Focus areas: Arts, culture, society. They are looking for: Cultural docs showcasing German arts/culture to international audiences; social docs on contemporary Germany.
thematic_priorities: Cultural docs showcasing German arts/culture to international audiences
Political documentaries exploring Germany's role in international affairs
Science documentaries highlighting German innovation and research
Historical documentaries contextualizing Germany's past for international audiences
format_specifications: Both series and one-off, depending on story and slot
budget_parameters: Documentary: €80K–€150K per hour; Specialist Factual: €90K–€180K per hour
technical_requirements: Broadcast/streaming standards; details provided upon commissioning
Subtitles/captions; audio description per broadcaster requirements
submission_process: Two-page treatment with premise and international relevance
additional_info: Increasing focus on distinctive voices and cross-platform reach; Emphasis on diverse voices on- and off-screen; Encouragement of sustainable production practices; Support for projects from across German regions; Open to pitches from independent producers/companies
